    • Constructor Detail

      • DialogComponentTable

        public DialogComponentTable(SettingsModel model,
                            java.lang.String label)
        Constructor that puts label and combobox into panel. It expects the user to make a selection, thus, at least one item in the list of selectable items is required. When the settings are applied, the model stores one of the enumerations of the provided list.
        Parameters:
        model - The model that stores the values for this component. This model is required to implement also the TableModel interface.
        label - Label for dialog on top of the table.
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - Thrown, if the passed in model does not implement the TableModel interface.

    • Method Detail

      • getToolTipTextForCell

        public java.lang.String getToolTipTextForCell(int iRow,
                                              int iCol)
        Override this method to deliver a tooltip based on the cell where the mouse hovers. By default this method returns null, which will lead to the default tooltip that is set for the entire table.
        Parameters:
        iRow - Model based row index of cell.
        iCol - Model based column index of cell.

      • setToolTipText

        public void setToolTipText(java.lang.String text)

      • getTableModel

        public javax.swing.table.TableModel getTableModel()
        Returns the table model of this component, which is at the same time also the settings model and would be also returned with #getModel().
        Returns:
        Table model. Never null.

      • getTable

        public javax.swing.JTable getTable()
        Returns the table GUI component for further customization.
        Returns:
        Table of this component. Never null.

      • getScrollPane

        public javax.swing.JScrollPane getScrollPane()
        Returns the scroll pane GUI component of the table for further customization.
        Returns:
        Scroll pane of the table of this component. Never null.

      • getColumn

        public javax.swing.table.TableColumn getColumn(int index)
        Convenience method to get a table column for the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the table column to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The table column or null, if index is invalid.

      • setColumnWidths

        public void setColumnWidths(int... iColumnWidths)
        Convenience method to set widths for the columns of this table. The order of the provided values will be applied to the columns in the same order as they are returned by a call to JTable.getColumnModel().getColumn(x).
        Parameters:
        iColumnWidths - Widths of columns. Values that should not be changed can be set to -1.

      • setMinColumnWidths

        public void setMinColumnWidths(int... iMinColumnWidths)
        Convenience method to set minimum widths for the columns of this table. The order of the provided values will be applied to the columns in the same order as they are returned by a call to JTable.getColumnModel().getColumn(x).
        Parameters:
        iMinColumnWidths - Minimum widths of columns. Values that should not be changed can be set to -1.

      • setMaxColumnWidths

        public void setMaxColumnWidths(int... iMaxColumnWidths)
        Convenience method to set maximal widths for the columns of this table. The order of the provided values will be applied to the columns in the same order as they are returned by a call to JTable.getColumnModel().getColumn(x).
        Parameters:
        iMaxColumnWidths - Maximal widths of columns. Values that should not be changed can be set to -1.

      • updateComponent

        protected void updateComponent()

      • validateSettingsBeforeSave

        protected void validateSettingsBeforeSave()
                                   throws InvalidSettingsException
        Does not do anything in this implementation, because the table model and the table component are directly connected.
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException

                                       throws NotConfigurableException
        Throws:
        NotConfigurableException
